pronunciation: WALLOW, [Latin , G. This verb seems to be connected with well, walk, etc.]

definitions.text:
seems to be connected with well, walk, etc.]
1. To roll ones body on the earth, in mire, or on other substance; to tumble and roll in water. Swine wallow in the mire.
2. To move heavily and clumsily.Part huge of bulk, wallowing unwieldy, enormous in their gait, tempest the ocean. [Unusual.]
3. To live in filth or gross vice; as man wallowing in his native impurity.WALLOW,
To roll ones body.WALLOW thyself in ashes. Jeremiah 6:26.WALLOW,
